input: question: What city was the plan based on? [SEP] sentence: The plan, a grid with two main axes meeting at a central square and an additional square in each corner, was based on Thomas Holme's 1682 plan for Philadelphia.

question: Hg I2a2 was believed to have arisen where? [SEP] sentence: According to original studies, Hg I2a2 was believed to have arisen in the west Balkans sometime after the LGM, subsequently spreading from the Balkans through Central Russian Plain.
question: What medals did Kerry win? [SEP] sentence: For that service, he was awarded combat medals that include the Silver Star Medal, Bronze Star Medal, and three Purple Heart Medals.

question: Who was the governor of North carolina in 1767? [SEP] sentence: Officially established in 1792 as both county seat and state capital, the city was named after Sir Walter Raleigh, sponsor of Roanoke, the "lost colony" on Roanoke Island.

question: How pathogenes interact with it's human host? [SEP] sentence: Yet these organisms are also part of the normal human flora and usually exist on the skin or in the nose without causing any disease at all.

question: Which church is affiliated with the Evangelical Presbyterian Church in Malawi? [SEP] sentence: Part of the Presbyterian Church in Malawi and Zambia is known as CCAP, Church of Central Africa-Presbyterian.
question: What property of wood has a correlation to its density? [SEP] sentence: The density of a wood correlates with its strength (mechanical properties).

question: Of the 20,000 Jehovah's Witnesses in Germany in 1933, how many were later imprisoned? [SEP] sentence: In 1933, there were approximately 20,000 Jehovah's Witnesses in Germany, of whom about 10,000 were later imprisoned.
question: By whom was Marcel Duchamp labeled an Orphanist? [SEP] sentence: Also labeled an Orphist by Apollinaire, Marcel Duchamp was responsible for another extreme development inspired by Cubism.

question: New research has clarified that Federalism has how many distinct forms? [SEP] sentence: This clarified definition opens the way to identifying two distinct federal forms, where before only one was known, based upon whether sovereignty resides in the whole (in one people) or in the parts (in many peoples): the federal state (or federation) and the federal union of states (or federal union), respectively.
question: A rheostat is the size and shape of what? [SEP] sentence: This rheostat (see picture) was enclosed within a cylindrical container about the size and shape of a cake.

question: What school of Yale is located nearest the intersection of Prospect and Sachem streets? [SEP] sentence: Popular farmers' markets, managed by the local non-profit CitySeed, set up shop weekly in several neighborhoods, including Westville/Edgewood Park, Fair Haven, Upper State Street, Wooster Square, and Downtown/New Haven Green.

question: What state's law requires that capital punishment occur "within the walls" of a penitentiary? [SEP] sentence: North Carolina General Statute § 15-188 requires death sentences to be executed "within the walls" of the penitentiary, as do Oklahoma Statute Title 22 § 1015 and Montana Code § 46-19-103.
question: What did peasant women do when it was time for the harvest? [SEP] sentence: At harvest-time, they were also expected to help with field-work.

question: Who is the only exception from whom Hayek claims to have learned more than he did from Popper? [SEP] sentence: In a letter to Hayek in 1944, Popper stated, "I think I have learnt more from you than from any other living thinker, except perhaps Alfred Tarski."

question: In what year did the British take Swaziland on as a protectorate? [SEP] sentence: Much of its early administration (for example, postal services) being carried out from South Africa until 1906 when the Transvaal colony was granted self-government.
